text: by default using {% include "filehere.html" %} will include a bunch of HTML comments for when the include stops/starts on the rendered page
is there a parameter to not include the comments on the rendered page?
I will check but I don’t believe so. What’s the reason you’d like them removed? it’s usually helpful to have those comments for debugging
yeah more a curiosity than a necessity most pages don't have a ton anyway but thinking about how google measures markup vs actual content as part of its algorithm
I would not expect Google to factor comments into any kind of performance metrics.

Code to content was a metric that was measured in the past. Not sure how that affects anything today. 

I’d prefer that the comments would be turned off as well. If I want to debug I’d turn on debug.
